title: Quotient rule
summary: In calculus, the quotient rule is a method of finding the derivative of a function that is the ratio of two differentiable functions.[1][2][3] Let h ( x ) = f ( x ) / g ( x ) , {\displaystyle h(x)=f(x)/g(x),} where both f and g are differentiable and g ( x ) â‰  0. {\displaystyle g(x)\neq 0.} The quotient rule states that the derivative of h(x) is
